title: Chicago-Style Hot Dog Recipe
description: All-beef hot dog on a poppy seed bun with mustard, relish, onion, tomato, pickle, sport peppers, and celery salt, made Chicago-style with no ketchup.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe:¬†Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Main Dishes Sandwich Recipes Hot Dogs and Corn Dogs Recipes Chicago-Style Hot Dog 4.8 (314) 229 Reviews 61 Photos This hot dog is a Windy City classic and a big favorite with sports fans! The frank must be all-beef, the bun must be poppy seed, and the ingredients must be piled onto the bun in the order specified. And whatever you do, don't spoil the splendor of this Chicago dog with ketchup! Submitted by elsaw Updated on February 15, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 61 61 61 61 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 1 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 1 servings 1 all-beef hot dog 1 poppy seed hot dog bun 1 tablespoon yellow mustard 1 tablespoon sweet green pickle relish 1 tablespoon chopped onion 2 tomato wedges 1 dill pickle spear 2 sport peppers 1 dash celery salt Directions Bring a pot of water to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low, place hot dog in water, and cook until warmed through, about 5 minutes. Remove hot dog from water and set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place a steamer basket into the pot and steam poppy seed bun until warm, about 2 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place hot dog in steamed bun. Pile on toppings in this order: mustard, relish, onion, tomato, pickle, peppers, and celery salt. The tomato wedges should be nestled between hot dog and top of bun on one side. Place pickle between hot dog and bottom of bun on the other side. Don't even think about ketchup! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS¬† I Made It Print 388 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 726 Calories 34g Fat 83g Carbs 26g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 1 Calories 726 % Daily Value * Total Fat 34g 43% Saturated Fat 12g 61% Cholesterol 56mg 19% Sodium 2082mg 91% Total Carbohydrate 83g 30% Dietary Fiber 9g 32% Total Sugars 23g Protein 26g 52% Vitamin C 200mg 222% Calcium 282mg 22% Iron 7mg 39% Potassium 1319mg 28% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Chicago-Style Hot Dog 01 of 61 Photo by¬† DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS¬† 02 of 61 Photo by¬† OddLadle3977 01/25/2024 This recipe was delicious! I fried the hotdog. My husband brought the relish, celery salt and sport peppers from Chicago. I used Pepperidge hotdog buns. 03 of 61 Photo by¬† BrightHen9605 07/04/2023 Here in Iowa, I do make trips back to Chicago to lay in a supply of Vienna Red Hots, and Vienna Sport Peppers and Relish. On my last trip I could not find any Rosens poppy seeded buns. Sad. Those buns are very difficult to locate. Pepperidge Farms top sliced buns are the best for us. On North Milwaukee Ave, of course is Super Dawg (close to the old homestead) - many years ago there was Tasty Pup nearby - they added thinly sliced cucumbers as well - I do that occasionally. And some folks prefer celery seed over celery salt.Once fully loaded, I put them back into the steamer for a minute. On my last trip I visited Gene and Judes too - near my old HS in River Grove. And Bob-O's on Irving Park near Cumberland is good too.Ive attached a photo of a Gene and Judes dog...yes, fries are piled on top 04 of 61 Photo by¬† coachmilr22 12/16/2022 One of my BEST HOT DOGS ü§§ü§§ü§§ 05 of 61 Photo by¬† qomike 06/20/2022 I live in a Chicago suburb and get these fairly often. This is a great set of toppings (also works on a bologna sandwich). Messy to eat, but tastes great!I did modify this recipe slightly - sliced the pickle spear (used a Famous Dave's spicy spear) in half down the long axis to make it thinner, placed hot dog (Vienna beef, pressed in an electric grill after I boiled it in water / cheap beer) in the poppy-seed bun, 2 sport peppers, then pickle spear over the sport peppers, roma tomato (three thin wedges) on the other side, increased the amount of diced onion and relish (used Vienna hotdog relish) as most places around here really pile that on, squirted generously with mustard, then shook on the celery salt. 06 of 61 Photo by¬† Nan 08/25/2021 07 of 61 Photo by¬† Vanessa Bursey 05/02/2021 08 of 61 Photo by¬† KC 10/05/2020 Made these several times, always forget to take a photo. I didn‚Äôt have poppy seed buns tonight, brioche worked just as well. Sport pepper‚Äôs make it official. Paired with air fryer French fries. Thanks for sharing. 09 of 61 Photo by¬† Berta Sims 08/23/2020 Yuuuuummmmy 10 of 61 Photo by¬† Sean Asistin 05/12/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Sharon's Awesome Chicago Chili 61 Ratings Chris' Bay Area Burger 905 Ratings Scott Hibb's Amazing Whisky Grilled Baby Back Ribs 1,411 Ratings Chicago Hot Dog-Style Salmon 1 Rating Pittsburgh Style Chipped Ham Barbeque 18 Ratings Philly Cheese Steak 40 Ratings Mary Pat's Tuna Melt 14 Ratings Flatlander Chili 2,494 Ratings Seattle Cream Cheese Dogs 163 Ratings Chicken Chili Soup 145 Ratings Easy Barbeque Beef Tenderloin Steak 15 Ratings Brick-Oven Pizza (Brooklyn Style) 217 Ratings Detroit-Style Coney Dogs 28 Ratings Slow Cooker Philly Steak Sandwich Meat 112 Ratings Wisconsin Blue Ribbon Chili 24 Ratings Chicago Style Stuffed Pizza 72 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Place a steamer basket into the pot and steam poppy seed bun until warm, about 2 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Place hot dog in steamed bun. Pile on toppings in this order: mustard, relish, onion, tomato, pickle, peppers, and celery salt. The tomato wedges should be nestled between hot dog and top of bun on one side. Place pickle between hot dog and bottom of bun on the other side. Don't even think about ketchup! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
